revised_title: Preventing Dry-Rot in Ships: A Method by James Mease
tldr: James Mease discovered that filling the spaces between ship timbers with salt can prevent dry-rot, a type of wood decay that affects ships. The salt penetrates and saturates the wood, stopping fermentation and the production of foul air. This method helps to preserve ships and improve their durability.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Shipbuilding and Maritime Engineering
